meanings.definition: A large ground-dwelling rodent of the squirrel family, typically found in mountainous regions.
meanings.sent1: The marmot scurried across the rocky terrain.
meanings.sent2: I spotted a marmot peeking out from behind a boulder.
meanings.sent3: The marmot seemed to be playing hide-and-seek with its furry friends.
meanings.sent4: The marmot's burrow was a cozy retreat in the vast wilderness.
meanings.sent5: The marmot's fluffy coat kept it warm in the chilly mountain air.

meanings.definition: To behave in a timid or cowardly manner.
meanings.sent1: Don't marmot around when facing challenges; be brave!
meanings.sent2: She tends to marmot when asked to speak in public.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to marmot away from the playful puppy.
meanings.sent4: He decided to marmot out of the difficult situation.
meanings.sent5: In the face of danger, she chose to marmot instead of taking action.
